page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF AREA
page.content: Our area is on the North Coast of Scotland,East of{Thurso}and West of{ {John O'Groats}.The landscape is undulating and dotted with farms and houses,both old and new.The highest point,part of{Olrig Hill},is 400ft. above sea level. The area is given over mainly to stock-rearing{farmland},rearing both { {cattle}and{sheep}.Most farms are about 200 acres in size,but there are larger farms of up to 800 acres and also some crofts of about 60 acres.The farms are owner managed and run as family businesses.Field boundaries are marked by fences,dry stone dykes,flagstone fences and there is a little hedging.There are two areas of deciduous{woodland,}one at{Olrig,}and one at{Castlehill.}There is a village called{Castletown}with a population of about 1 000 people.
